citation.article-title: Evaluation of the genus Listonella and reassignment of Listonella damsela (Love et al.) MacDonell and Colwell to the genus Photobacterium as Photobacterium damsela comb. nov. with an emended description.

p.s: Emended description of Photobacterium damsela (Love et al. 1981) Smith, Sutton, Fuerst, and Reichelt comb. nov.
Photobacterium damsela (dam.se'la. M.L. n. damsela, pertaining to damselfish)
Gram-negative, straight rods that are motile by means of one or more unsheathed polar flagella.
Facultatively anaerobic, often with weak gas production.
Able to accumulate the storage product PHB when grown on medium containing glucose, but unable to utilize the exogenous monomer DL-β-hydroxybutyrate.
Arginine dihydrolase and urease tests are strongly positive.
Oxidase, Voges-Proskauer, and extracellular lipase tests are weakly positive.
No growth occurs in the absence of sodium ions.
Negative for the production of the extracellular enzymes amylase, alginase, and gelatinase.
The following carbon compounds are utilized as sole carbon and energy sources in the presence of 0.05% yeast extract; pyruvate, lactate, glutamate, mannose, galactose, cellobiose, and glycerate.
Utilization of serine and utilization of α-ketoglutarate in the presence of 0.05% yeast extract are variable.
In the absence of 0.05% yeast extract, growth on all of the compounds listed above is variable or negative.

The following compounds are not utilized as sole carbon and energy sources in the presence or absence of 0.05% yeast extract: L-arabinose, D-gluconate, L-rhamnose, salicin, D-xylose, caprate, caproate, butyrate, caprylate, heptanoate, isobutyrate, isovalerate, pelargonate, propionate, valerate, DL-β-hydroxybutyrate, aconitate, citrate, betaine, hippurate, sarcosine, glutarate, malonate, mannitol, sorbitol, ethanol, n-propanol, benzoate, p-hydroxybenzoate, quinate, tyrosine, D-α-alanine, β-alanine, γ-aminobutyrate, β-aminovalerate, arginine, citrulline, glycine, L-leucine, L-ornithine, putrescine, and spermine.
Isolated from healthy and diseased marine animals, human wounds, and seawater.
The type strain is strain ATCC 33539.
The description of this strain is the same as that given for the species except that this isolate utilizes α-ketoglutarate and serine in the presence of 0.05% yeast extract.
